abstract.p: Chinese central bank head Dai Xianglong is again working to make its currency fully convertible (S)m

block.p: China's chief central banker said the country had put full convertibility of the country's currency back on the agenda after having suspended such plans during the Asian economic crisis two years ago. ''With China's World Trade Organization entry, we will gradually push forward the process of capital account convertibility,'' said Dai Xianglong, governor of the People's Bank of China, according to the state-run China Daily. The country has long planned to make its currency, known as the renminbi, or people's money, fully convertible.
